meanings.definition: Slang term for a sudden failure or breakdown.
meanings.sent1: When the old car's engine made a loud blooey, we knew it was time for a new one.
meanings.sent2: The fireworks made a loud blooey in the night sky, dazzling everyone.
meanings.sent3: The birthday cake looked perfect until it made a blooey and collapsed into a mess.
meanings.sent4: His plan to surprise her with flowers went blooey when she found out beforehand.
meanings.sent5: The blooey of the balloon popping made everyone jump in surprise.

meanings.definition: Slang term for a loud, explosive noise.
meanings.sent1: The blooey of the firecracker echoed through the neighborhood, startling the birds.
meanings.sent2: The blooey of the thunderstorm could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent3: The blooey of the balloon popping made the children giggle with excitement.
meanings.sent4: The blooey of the car backfiring made everyone turn their heads in surprise.
meanings.sent5: The blooey of the cannon firing signaled the start of the race.

meanings.definition: Slang term for something going wrong or not going as planned.
meanings.sent1: His perfect day at the beach went blooey when it started raining.
meanings.sent2: The surprise party went blooey when the guest of honor arrived early.
meanings.sent3: The baking experiment went blooey when the cake collapsed in the oven.
meanings.sent4: Her attempt to fix the leaky faucet went blooey when she made it worse.
meanings.sent5: The camping trip went blooey when they realized they forgot the tent poles.
